layoutEditor.addOverlayTooltip: Choose an overlay from the list to add
layoutEditor.browserDemoUrlTooltip: url to use to see the layout with generated demo data in your streaming software
layoutEditor.browserUrlTooltip: url to use in your streaming software
layoutEditor.customResolutionHorizontalTooltip: The horizontal size of the layout on the X axes on your screen(s). (Double click for quick editing)
layoutEditor.customResolutionVerticalTooltip: The vertical size of the layout on the Y axes on your screen(s). (Double click for quick editing)
layoutEditor.layoutTooltip: Set the resolution as well as different overlays for both your own Display or Stream

notifications.screenChangeContent: Please reopen the layout window for the changes to take effect

masterSettingsAlert.content: Your are using Master settings for this overlay, You will need to make changes to your master for this overlay.
masterSettingsAlert.title: Master Settings Enabled

overlaySettings.useMasterSettingsTooltip: Use your master overlay settings instead of configuring the overlay settings over and over again. This is your master overlay setting. The changes you make at your master overlay settings will be synced with this overlay settings.
overlaySettings.disableOverlayTooltip: Disables the overlay in the layout . Useful if you don't want to delete it, just temporarly disabling it.

layoutEditor.resolutionTooltip: Select a resolution that matches your screen resolution
layoutEditor.screenTooltip: Select a screen the layout should activate on
layoutEditor.sessionSpecificTooltip: Choose session specific or all-in-one layout. Selecting Yes will let you define layouts for each sessions.
layoutEditor.xOffsetTooltip: The offset to set to the layout on the X axes on your screen(s). (Double click for quick editing)
layoutEditor.yOffsetTooltip: The offset to set to the layout on the Y axes on your screen(s). (Double click for quick editing)

activatingConditions.carsTooltip: You can create a layout for specific cars. Choose a car and the layout will activate when you're using that car
activatingConditions.gameModeTooltip: You can create a layout for offline (solo, career mode) or decide to create a layout for multiplayer game mode
activatingConditions.layoutNameTooltip: Name your layouts to easily identify it
activatingConditions.spotterTooltip: Create a spotter layout by turning this option on. The layout will activate when you're looking at someone.

layoutListItem.activeLabelTooltip: This layout is currently active. Layouts activate based on the conditions you set below (by clicking on the edit button)
layoutListItem.conflictingTooltip: This layout is currently not active because it's conflicting with another layout. Layout conflicts happen when you define the same activation 'rules' (category, series, cars, etc..) for multiple layouts.
layoutListItem.disabledLabelTooltip: This layout is currently disabled. It will not activate, even if the layout conditions are met for this layout

mainLayoutPage.accAdditionalInstructions: Only one layout is active at a time, the one that meet the game mode and cars requirements the most.
mainLayoutPage.f1AdditionalInstructions: Only one layout is active at a time, the one that meet the game mode and cars requirements the most.
mainLayoutPage.instructions: Layouts: You can create multiple layouts and assign specific category, series to it. There are always one layout activated on your screen, the one that is matching your category/series values you set for each layout.
mainLayoutPage.iRacingAdditionalInstructions: Only one layout is active at a time, the one that meet the category and series requirements the most.
mainLayoutPage.tutorialVideoContent: Watch the tutorial video that shows you how to use the layout builder step by step.
mainLayoutPage.lmuAdditionalInstructions: Only one layout is active at a time, the one that meet the game mode requirement the most.
